title: Graph Signature: A Simple Approach for Clustering Similar Graph

author: Rashid Jalal Qureshi, François Rabelais University

segmentation: Thank you, thank you Sir.
Good afternoon everybody.
I am rushing Sal Qureshi, PhD student Registry, France forcibly of two in France, and usually we work on graphic recognition.
This is the Technical Committee number 10 and I would like to present graph signature which can be used as a simple approach for clustering.
Similar graph and the technique is applied on graphic symbol recognition.

Well, the plan included a brief introduction of the domain and then in the graph based symbol representation section I will show you how we have extracted the graphic primitives from the shapes and then I will show you how we can generate the attributed graph from these shapes.
Then we will see how the feature can be extracted from the graph to get a feature vector and using graph signature we can.
We can do simple recognition followed by some results and conclusion and process.
Actors.
Well, in a document image analysis in the field of document image analysis, the there are two major portions in our document page.
You can see there is a text part and there is a graphic part.
So on as far as the text recognition are, the OCR is concerned a good number of methods have been developed over the years and professional software do exist.
What we are concerned with the graphic portion of the page or text image.
So line recognition, logo recognition and summer recognition are the three hot areas under research I'm going to work on simple recognition.
So the idea is to convert the graphic symbol into an attributed graph and then graph matching for the recognition purpose.
So what are samples?
Samples are generally 2 dimensional binary shapes composed of lines.
Arcs are filled areas that represent something in the specific application domain.
In this slide I'm showing you some of the architectural symbols and electrical symbols, so these are assembled which represent doors, windows, beds, etc.
So in order to generate the attributed graph, we have to 1st extract the graphic primitive out of the samples.
For that, we vectorize the contours of the sample.
It is a control based approach and not a skeleton based approach.
So we have a list of vector representing the external contour of the shape and the list of vector representing the internal control of the shapes.
These two lists are studied an opposite.
Vectors are matched together.
To get a list of quadrilaterals so we can see the image in blue there are five quadrilateral have been extracted from the initial symbol.
Here are a few more examples of the symbols and their graph based their quadrilateral based representation.
When is quadrilateral has certain properties and certain attributes like length of the median axis angle of the two vectors.
Vet on each side and a zone of influence.
This zone of influence will play a vital role in the graph generation phase.
We will see in a moment.
The coordinates of the zone of influence depends on the length and the width of the quadrilateral, in fact.
So in our graph, each quadrilateral will become node of the graph and for that to study the neighborhood relationship are the connectivity of the nodes.
What we do is study of the zone of influence of each quadrilateral.
For example, in the zone of influence of quadrilateral number one only quadrilateral #2 is falling.
So we have a connecting edge between one and two.
On the other hand, if we can see.
The quite related number two.
There are three other quadrotor are falling in this zone of influence that is 1, three and four.
So in this way we study all the quadrilaterals and their respective zone of influence and we fuse these subgraphs to form the complete neighborhood graph.
Once we get the nodes of the graph and their connecting edges, Now we associate certain attributes to these nodes and edges.

For example, the relative length of the quadrilateral has been associated to the nodes as an attribute and which is actually a ratio of the length of the correlator to the largest quadriliteral found in that image.
On the edges we have two other attributes, that is the type of connection and relative angle.
For example, we have defined certain topological relationship between these squads.
Here we can see that the quadrotor can be connected in a T shaped junction or they can be parallel.
We can be successful without junction L. Add an intersection X type connection while the relative angle between the two correlator are considered also as an attribute over the edges.
So we can see that from the initial image we extracted the graphic primitive and then studying their relative attributes.
We associated them to the node and edges and we have a very good representation of the symbol in terms of graph.
Once we have developed the graph, now it was a decision to be made.

What graph matching should be used, because the graph isomorphism, subgraph isomorphism, our maximum common subgraph, the plus point is always there that they are optimal in providing the solution, but NP complete in the worst case and they are not robust to noise and distortion.
Well, we have aerotolerant methods like graph edit distance or similarity based method.
So we give first try to dissimilarity based method.
It is actually the motivation why we have developed the graphs.
Midget so.

Or their structural and statistical methods have been involved and a good number of methods have been proposed, so it sometime it's rather good to refine the existing algorithms as compared to developing a new one.
So the algorithm greedy algorithm proposed by Shampa in 2003.
We have used that algorithm and we proposed a new similarity formula.
Our scoring function to calculate the score of a mapping.
So this scoring function in fact has three major portion and we can see there's a vertex to vertex similarity.
There is an abstract similarity and there is split as penalty.
For example here Delta we represent.
It's actually the function which is the similarity of the attributes of the nodes.
And as in our graph for the time being, we have only one attribute that is relative length.
So here F1 represent the absolute difference of the two relative lengths on the edges we have the.
Here the Delta E represent a function which is actually the absolute difference of the two relative angles.
The third portion is splits as penalties be cause of the noise or distortion.
We can see that the quadrilateral can be broken and therefore we allow the Association of 1 correlator to more than one correlator.
That is, the IT is a multi valent graph matching that a node in one graph can be associated to more than one node in the other graph.
So.
Let's have a quick look on the greedy algorithm.
It is actually start with an empty mapping and in each iteration it is an incremental algorithms.
In each iteration we search for the candidate pair that is a node pair from G1 and G2 which has the potential to increase this core function.
So starting with an empty mapping which.
Which satisfy the condition that the note there is not present in the current mapping.
We try to put to include that node pair into the current mapping and compute the score function using our new similarity formula.

If this core function increase, we keep the new current mapping as the best mapping and its core is stored as the best score and this iterative process continu until all the nodes have been mapped are this course stop increasing.
Here is a little example is simple example distrait how it works.
For example, when node A is associated to one and so this is a kind of mapping first simple mapping, the score was computed as two.
When the node B is associated to two, so there is an edge which now play role.
So the edge AB is now mapped to edge 1 two.
So these for this mapping is called is increased to 4.6 for example.
When when note C is associated to note two, we see that the score is decreased because of the split off node #2 which is associated to two other nodes.
So we have allowed this splits but it is considered as a penalty and it will decrease the score.
Testing on a graphic recognition software database that is Greg 2003.
We achieved good results.
In fact, the idea was to.
Mix the method to get a method to to use graph as a representational structure.
Because of the inherent feature of graph that is in variation of to rotations, we see that the rotation is 100%.

Recognition rate is 100% in case of rotation and thanks to the relative attributes that we consider on the nodes, the recognition rate is 100% on the scaling as well as far as noise level concerned, or distortion it.
The recognition rate was decreased.
The proposed similarity measure work well and same graph algorithm do give this solution in polynomial time.
But still we are not satisfied because what we are expecting is something really fast.

For example, when you want to search a word and you type something in Google and it gives you the good search result in real time and the same we can we want to apply on the graph examples that if somebody draw.
Something and it should give the results in few milliseconds and not in minutes.
And unlike OCR in graphic recognition, we have a good number.
We have a great number of graph examples to treat.

So that is why we consider that it is better to use graphic signature and to transform the graph representation of the graph example into one dimensional feature vector, which is fast to compute and rather easy to store and manipulate.
So the three type of discriminating feature that we have extracted from the graph.
Consist of quantitative features.
For example, the number of nodes in a graph, number of edges in a graph, and degree of the graph.
That is, how many there are nodes which are connected to 1234 or five or more than five vertices.
Symbolic feature is actually the type of connection.
It is the frequency.
The study of the frequency of certain label which are present on the edges and the range features include also the frequency.
That is how many edges.
With certain range of relative angle R. Said it
So this is the set of 23 features that we have been extracted from the graph.
Including the quantitative symbolic ending.
Features.

So once we transform the graph into the feature vector, Now we can compute the equivalent distance as as a smell of similarity and the distance metrics have been computed for all the samples present in the database.
And here we can see that the distorted symbol versus model.
A distance.
Metrics.
And thereafter we can use nearest neighbor rule for the classification.
So we believe that too graphic symbols are similar if the creating distance of their feature vector is relatively small.
So this graph signature actually helps us in finding the similar assemble out of the database and finding the cluster of similar symbol for certain model.
But
Yeah, there is a compromise that the recognition rate has been decreased up to 92% for example, so this is.

Again, there is an improvement that we can suggest that OK, we use graph signature for clustering similar sample and once we get this cluster of a certain sample certain model thereafter we can use greedy algorithm for to acquire the precision and to get the closest match.
So I think the combination of these two methods will work well and the tests are understudied also.
I will conclude with the these remarks that data relative attributes on graph vertices and edges our graph based sample representation are invariant off rotation and scaling.
Graph Signature is a fast method because it is very easy to compute from an attributed graph.
The technique is fairly Journal and can be used to cluster similar graph together and for higher precision we can couple polynomial time.
Other algorithms with graph signature and a weighted distance measure are some other statistical classifier can also be used to improve the performance for which tests are understudied.
So I thank you all for listening and if there are any question or suggestion I will.
